Response1.Answer: People who prioritize tasks that are more meaningful are happier.
People who prioritize tasks that take less time appear to feel more accomplished.
People who do things in one sitting feel like they accomplish more.

Response2.Answer: People who put subtasks in their calendar seem to be more satisfied than those who cluster one general task to  a specific block of time.
People who allocate time in their schedule to prepare before they start working seem to accomplish more during their work day.

Response3.Answer: People who use checklists tend are more likely to accomplish their tasks on time.
Using reminders helps people stay on task and accomplish more in a shorter period of time.
